original_solution_mapping.L1: Jimmy earned 20 * 3 = <<20*3=60>>60 points for the exams he wrote.
original_solution_mapping.L2: For bad behavior, he lost 5 points, so he has 60 - 5 = <<60-5=55>>55 points left.
original_solution_mapping.L3: To pass to the next class, Jimmy needs at least 50 points, so he can lose 55 - 50 = <<55-50=5>>5 more points.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6577.
    Returns: how many more points Jimmy can lose and still pass the class.
    """
    # L1
    points_per_exam = 20 # 20 points for each of the 3 exams
    num_exams = 3 # 3 exams he wrote
    points_from_exams = points_per_exam * num_exams

    # L2
    points_lost_behavior = 5 # lost 5 points during the school year for bad behavior
    points_after_loss = points_from_exams - points_lost_behavior

    # L3
    points_to_pass = 50 # needs to score at least 50 points to pass
    additional_points_can_lose = points_after_loss - points_to_pass

    # FA
    answer = additional_points_can_lose
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Jimmy earned {points_per_exam} * {num_exams} = <<{points_per_exam}*{num_exams}={points_from_exams}>>{points_from_exams} points for the exams he wrote.

For bad behavior, he lost {points_lost_behavior} points, so he has {points_from_exams} - {points_lost_behavior} = <<{points_from_exams}-{points_lost_behavior}={points_after_loss}>>{points_after_loss} points left.

To pass to the next class, Jimmy needs at least {points_to_pass} points, so he can lose {points_after_loss} - {points_to_pass} = <<{points_after_loss}-{points_to_pass}={additional_points_can_lose}>>{additional_points_can_lose} more points.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Jimmy earned 20 * 3 = <<20*3=60>>60 points for the exams he wrote.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: For bad behavior, he lost 5 points, so he has 60 - 5 = <<60-5=55>>55 points left.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: To pass to the next class, Jimmy needs at least 3 points, so he can lose 55 - 3 = <<55-3=52>>52 more points.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'num_exams' (3) was used instead of 'points_to_pass' (50).
